title: Ticket #708: The condor_credd on Win32 is crashing frequently
description:
User is running the condor_credd (as well as negotiator, collector) in a Windows Server 2003 virtual machine running on VMWare ESX.

The credd crashed with an ACCESS_VIOLATION eight times in the past two days.

Log files and other details are in the attached RUST ticket.

With a quick look over the logs, it seems that every crash was preceded by an entry in the log similar to : 

   9/1 10:48:19 getStoredCredential(): Could not locate credential for user 'vassilisd@xxxxx'

Awfully suspicious, eh?
remarks:
2009-Sep-03 09:50:08 by tannenba:
Patch written, pushed to V7_2-branch, and merged to V7_3_2-branch and master. Support RUST user notified, RUST ticket resolved. Closing this ticket.
check_ins: 2009-Sep-02 18:31   Check-in [15612]: Fix bug that can cause condor_credd to crash on Win32. (#708) The condor_credd on Win32 will likely crash with an ACCESS_VIOLATION in dprintf if a credential is requested that is not in the password store - this patches fixes that problem. (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: tannenba
